hint.text: Calculate volume of the two cylindrical items.

solution.text:
Radius of cylindrical utensil, R\(=_{{l*j}}_\,cm\)
Height of cylindrical utensil, H\(=_{{m*k}}_\,cm\)
Radius of cylindrical jug, r\(=_{j}_\,cm\)
Height of cylindrical jug, h\(=_{k}_\,cm\)
Volume of cylindrical utentil\(=\pi R^2H\)
\(=\pi \times _{{l*j}}_^2 \times _{{m*k}}_\)
\(=_{{trunc((pi_val*l*l*j*j*m*k),3)}}_\,cm^3\)
Volume of cylindrical jug\(=\pi r^2h\)
\(=\pi \times _{j}_^2 \times _{k}_\)
\(=_{{trunc((pi_val*j*j*k),3)}}_\,cm^3\)
No. of jugs supplied\(=\frac{volume\,of\,cylindrical\,utensil}{volume\,of\,cylindrical\,jug}\)
\(=\frac{_{{trunc((pi_val*l*l*j*j*m*k),3)}}_}{_{{trunc((pi_val*j*j*k),3)}}_}\)
\(=_{{l*l*m}}_\)
Daily turnover\(=\)No. of jugs supplied \(\times\) Price of each jug
\(=_{{l*l*m}}_ \times 50\)
\(=\)Rs.\(_{{l*l*m*50}}_\)

content.text: A local tea provider supplies evening tea to all the offices in his surrounding area. He cooks the tea in a cylindrical utensil of base radius \(_{{l*j}}_\)cm and height \(_{{m*k}}_\)cm. The tea is then filled in smaller cylindrical jugs of radius \(_{j}_\) cm and height \(_{k}_\)cm for distribution. What is the providers daily turnover if he sells the tea at Rs. \(50\) per jug.
